Package main

Class ODESolvers

java.lang.Object
main.ODESolvers
public class ODESolvers extends Object
This class contains all of our ODE solvers and their calculations

  • Method Details

    • eulerCalculation

      public static double[] eulerCalculation​(double[] vector, double h, double howLong)
      Euler calculation. This method takes vector, stepsize, and howlong parameters. It calculates new velocity and new acceleration for every step and keeps working until the time simulated is greater then howlomg then it returns new state vector
      Parameters:
      vector - original state
      h - stepsize
      howLong - how long should it run (0.01666) for 60 fps
      Returns:
      new state vector

    • rungeKutta2

      public static double[] rungeKutta2​(double[] stateVector, double h, double howLong)
      This method contains the entire Runge Kutta 2nh order algorithm. For each iteration it starts by calculating the acceleration at that point and time. It then calculates the next position of the ball using a combination of predictions from K1 and K2 . It updates the vector state and runs until either an end-game condition is met or howLong time is smaller than simulated time. This Runge Kutta second order method has a midpoint at 2/3 and is also known as the Ralston method.
      Parameters:
      stateVector - state of the ball at the beginning
      h - the step size of the Runge Kutta algorithm
      howLong - how much time should this code simulate, to link with the framerate (0.016666666 for 60fps)
      Returns:
      double[]: new updated vector after howLong time-span, or at end-game point For more information, see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Runge%E2%80%93Kutta_methods#Second-order_methods_with_two_stages

    • rungeKutta4

      public static double[] rungeKutta4​(double[] stateVector, double h, double howLong)
      This method contains the entire Runge Kutta 4th order algorithm ("Classic Runge-Kutta Method"). For each iteration it starts by calculating the acceleration at that point and time. It then calculates the next position of the ball using a combination of predictions from K1 to K4. It updates the vector state and runs until either an end-game condition is met or howLong time is smaller than simulated time.
      Parameters:
      stateVector - state of the ball at the beginning
      h - the step size of the Runge Kutta algorithm
      howLong - how much time should this code simulate, to link with the framerate (0.016666666 for 60fps)
      Returns:
      double[]: new updated vector after howLong time-span, or at end-game point For more info, see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Runge%E2%80%93Kutta_methods

    • eulerCalculationFrames

      public static void eulerCalculationFrames​(double[] vector, double h, double howLong)
      Euler calculation. This method takes vector, stepsize, and howlong parameters. It calculates new velocity and new acceleration for every step and keeps working until the end game condition adding new frame every 0.016 sec.
      Parameters:
      vector - original state
      h - stepsize
      howLong - how long should it run (0.01666) for 60 fps

    • rungeKutta2Frames

      public static void rungeKutta2Frames​(double[] stateVector, double h, double howLong)
      This method contains the entire Runge Kutta 2nh order algorithm. For each iteration it starts by calculating the acceleration at that point and time. It then calculates the next position of the ball using a combination of predictions from K1 and K2 . It updates the vector state and runs until an end-game condition is met adding frames to FramesQueue every 0.016666 sec. This Runge Kutta second order method has a midpoint at 2/3 and is also known as the Ralston method.
      Parameters:
      stateVector - state of the ball at the beginning
      h - the step size of the Runge Kutta algorithm
      howLong - how much time should this code simulate, to link with the frame rate (0.016666666 for 60fps) For more information, see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Runge%E2%80%93Kutta_methods#Second-order_methods_with_two_stages

    • rungeKutta4Frames

      public static void rungeKutta4Frames​(double[] stateVector, double h, double howLong)
      This method contains the entire Runge Kutta 4th order algorithm ("Classic Runge-Kutta Method"). For each iteration it starts by calculating the acceleration at that point and time. It then calculates the next position of the ball using a combination of predictions from K1 to K4. It updates the vector state and runs until an end-game condition is met adding frames to FramesQueue every 0.016666 sec.
      Parameters:
      stateVector - state of the ball at the beginning
      h - the step size of the Runge Kutta algorithm
      howLong - how much time should this code simulate, to link with the frame rate (0.016666666 for 60fps) For more info, see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Runge%E2%80%93Kutta_methods
